intro: Senecio fadyenii, commonly known as the Fadyen's groundsel, is a flowering plant native to South Africa. It belongs to the Asteraceae family, which includes daisies and sunflowers, and is characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant typically grows in rocky or sandy soils and thrives in full sun. It features narrow, linear leaves and produces small yellow flowers that bloom in spring. Due to its ornamental value and unique appearance, it is sometimes cultivated in gardens.
